dist2

PURPOSE

DIST2 Calculates squared distance between two sets of points.

SYNOPSIS

function n2 = dist2(x, c)

DESCRIPTION 

DIST2    Calculates squared distance between two sets of points.

    Description
    D = DIST2(X, C) takes two matrices of vectors and calculates the
    squared Euclidean distance between them.  Both matrices must be of
    the same column dimension.  If X has M rows and N columns, and C has
    L rows and N columns, then the result has M rows and L columns.  The
    I, Jth entry is the  squared distance from the Ith row of X to the
    Jth row of C.

    See also
    GMMACTIV, KMEANS, RBFFWD

CROSS-REFERENCE INFORMATION

This function calls:
This function is called by:
  • PS2z2__discard_overlapping res= PSPz3_discard_overlapping(input_points,threshold)

SOURCE CODE 

0001 function n2 = dist2(x, c)
0002 %DIST2    Calculates squared distance between two sets of points.
0003 %
0004 %    Description
0005 %    D = DIST2(X, C) takes two matrices of vectors and calculates the
0006 %    squared Euclidean distance between them.  Both matrices must be of
0007 %    the same column dimension.  If X has M rows and N columns, and C has
0008 %    L rows and N columns, then the result has M rows and L columns.  The
0009 %    I, Jth entry is the  squared distance from the Ith row of X to the
0010 %    Jth row of C.
0011 %
0012 %    See also
0013 %    GMMACTIV, KMEANS, RBFFWD
0014 %
0015 
0016 %    Copyright (c) Christopher M Bishop, Ian T Nabney (1996, 1997)
0017 
0018 [ndata, dimx] = size(x);
0019 [ncentres, dimc] = size(c);
0020 if dimx ~= dimc
0021     error('Data dimension does not match dimension of centres')
0022 end
0023 
0024 n2 = (ones(ncentres, 1) * sum((x.^2)', 1))' + ...
0025           ones(ndata, 1) * sum((c.^2)',1) - ...
0026           2.*(x*(c'));
